entry.title: UNSEASONABLY HIGH TEMPERATURES CONTINUE THIS WEEK IN REGION
entry.summary: October 1, 2024 3:50 a.m. Unseasonably high temperatures are expected to continue for most of this week in the Umpqua Valley. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said a flat ridge of high pressure will lead to afternoon high temperatures in the low to mid 80s with the exception of Wednesday when highs will cool...

entry.title: RPS NAMES JEFF EICHENBUSCH AS SECURITY COORDINATOR
entry.summary: October 1, 2024 3:05 a.m. Roseburg Public Schools has named Jeff Eichenbusch as the new security coordinator for the district. Eichenbusch has lived in Douglas County since he was 3 years old. After graduating from Umpqua Valley Christian School in 1992, he pursued his education at Western Oregon University, earning a Bachelor of Science in...

entry.title: UMPQUA BREWFEST HAPPENING SATURDAY
entry.summary: October 1, 2024 2:50 a.m. Umpqua Watersheds is hosting the 13th annual Umpqua Brew Fest this Saturday. entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Family Search Center is hosting an open house from 2-7 p.m. Friday, Oct. 4, in celebration of National Family History month.

entry.summary: The Associates of Vietnam Veterans of America are hosting a spousal and survivor benefits educational seminar from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Nov. 2 at the Garden Valley Church.

entry.title: Risky play is theme for Early Childhood Care & Education Conference
entry.summary: The 2024 Early Childhood Care and Education conference will take over the Danny Lang Event Center at the Umpqua Community College campus, 1140 Umpqua College Road in Roseburg, on Oct. 4 and 5.

entry.title: Lawsuit filed against Blue and Gold logging project
entry.summary: Cascadia Wildlands and Oregon Wild filed a joint complaint in federal court Friday to challenge the Roseburg District Bureau of Land Management’s Blue and Gold logging project that would affect the Oregon Coast Range in the Umpqua River watershed.

entry.title: Geneva Academy student wins national anthem singing contest
entry.summary: Sidney Mauch, a fourth grade student at Geneva Academy, won first place in Oregon for grades K-8 in the Veterans of Foreign Wars Auxiliary's national anthem singing contest Get Excited for the Red, White and Blue.

entry.title: Drain hosts Oktoberfest with focus on Halloween
entry.summary: DRAIN — North Douglas County's Oktoberfest brought the community together with pumpkins, drinks, food, cider and games Saturday afternoon in Drain.

entry.title: We've Got Your Six event benefits veteran organizations
entry.summary: WINSTON — Vietnam Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 2468 fired up the grills Saturday afternoon, sending the smell of bratwurst, burgers and more into the air during the We’ve Got Your Six event at Riverbend Park in Winston.

entry.title: Tree School Umpqua teaches forestry, stewardship
entry.summary: Larry Hall has owned his Umpqua land for more than 50 years. On Saturday, he sat in a classroom at Umpqua Community College to learn new information in Tree School Umpqua.

entry.summary: September 28, 2024 10:20 a.m. Effective Saturday, the Emergency Fire Forest Closure order for the Devil’s Knob Fire has been rescinded. An Umpqua National Forest update said an administrative closure is now in effect for some roads in the Devil’s Knob footprint where firefighters are still working. Those roads will remain open to through traffic...

entry.title: Ladies boogie and bowl Thursday evening at TenDown Bowling
entry.summary: About 70 women dressed in sequins, sparkles and bright colors enjoyed a disco-themed, fundraising night of bowling Thursday at TenDown Bowling, which was decorated with disco balls.

entry.title: Visit the outdoors on National Public Lands Day
entry.summary: National Public Lands Day is Saturday, a day honored by the National Environmental Education Foundation and National Park Service and other federal agencies.

entry.title: OSP seized fentanyl-laced pills
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — An Oregon State Police trooper seized 100 pounds of fentanyl-laced pills earlier this week in Douglas County.

entry.title: Mercy Foundation receives grant to increase oral health capacity
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — CHI Mercy Health's Mercy Foundation received a $125,000 grant from CareQuest Institute for Oral Health to increase the capacity to address the oral health needs of Douglas County inpatient veterans who require acute dental care.

entry.title: Ask a Master Gardener: Mulch
entry.summary: Question: I just planted a new garden bed. But the plants are still small, leaving a lot of open area. What can I do now to help suppress weeds over the winter?
